intro: Celsia brachysepala, commonly known as the short-sepaled celsia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Celsia brachysepala is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in specialized gardens.
